bill_title: to clarify that certain communications between school psychologists and students are privileged.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify that certain communications between school psychologists and students are privileged. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 19-13-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-21.1. No counselor or school psychologist , certificated in accordance with the certification regulations of the South Dakota Board of Education and regularly employed as counselor or school psychologist for a private or public elementary or secondary school or school system in the State of South Dakota, may divulge to any other person, or be examined concerning any information or communication given to him the counselor or school psychologist in his the counselor's or school psychologist's official capacity by a student or an adult offering the communication or information unless: (1) This privilege is waived in writing by the student or the adult offering the communication or information ; or (2) The information or communication was made to the counselor or school psychologist for the express purpose of being communicated or of being made public; or (3) The counselor or school psychologist has reason to suspect, as a result of that information or communication, that the student has been subjected to child abuse or that the student's physical or mental health may be in jeopardy.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify that certain communications between school psychologists and students are privileged. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 19-13-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-21.1. No counselor or school psychologist , certificated in accordance with the certification regulations of the South Dakota Board of Education and regularly employed as counselor or school psychologist for a private or public elementary or secondary school or school system in the State of South Dakota, may divulge to any other person, or be examined concerning any information or communication given to him the counselor or school psychologist in his the counselor's or school psychologist's official capacity by a student or an adult offering the communication or information unless: (1) This privilege is waived in writing by the student or the adult offering the communication or information ; or (2) The information or communication was made to the counselor or school psychologist for the express purpose of being communicated or of being made public; or (3) The counselor or school psychologist has reason to suspect, as a result of that information or communication, that the student or some other person has been subjected to child abuse or that the student's physical or mental health may be in jeopardy. BILL HISTORY 1/14/98 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 40 1/22/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/98 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 178

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify that certain communications between school psychologists and students are privileged. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 19-13-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-21.1. No counselor or school psychologist , certificated in accordance with the certification regulations of the South Dakota Board of Education and regularly employed as counselor or school psychologist for a private or public elementary or secondary school or school system in the State of South Dakota, may divulge to any other person, or be examined concerning any information or communication given to him the counselor or school psychologist in his the counselor's or school psychologist's official capacity by a student unless: (1) This privilege is waived in writing by the student; or (2) The information or communication was made to the counselor or school psychologist for the express purpose of being communicated or of being made public; or (3) The counselor or school psychologist has reason to suspect, as a result of that information or communication, that the student has or some other persons have been subjected to child abuse or that the student's physical or mental health or the physical or mental health of other persons may be in jeopardy. BILL HISTORY 1/14/98 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 40 1/22/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/98 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 178 1/26/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 244 1/29/98 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 309 1/29/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 54, NAYS 9. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify that certain communications between school psychologists and students are privileged. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 19-13-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-21.1. No counselor or school psychologist , certificated in accordance with the certification regulations of the South Dakota Board of Education and regularly employed as counselor or school psychologist for a private or public elementary or secondary school or school system in the State of South Dakota, may divulge to any other person, or be examined concerning any information or communication given to him the counselor or school psychologist in his the counselor's or school psychologist's official capacity by a student unless: (1) This privilege is waived in writing by the student; or (2) The information or communication was made to the counselor or school psychologist for the express purpose of being communicated or of being made public; or (3) The counselor or school psychologist has reason to suspect, as a result of that information or communication, that the student has or some other persons have been subjected to child abuse or that the student's physical or mental health or the physical or mental health of other persons may be in jeopardy or that it is otherwise in the best interest of the child .
